channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: US urges Iran's new President Ebrahim Raisi to resume nuclear talks
item.description: The state department says Ebrahim Raisi should seize the opportunity to revive a landmark 2015 deal.

item.title: Belarus Olympian Timanovskaya says grandmother warned her not to come home
item.description: Krystina Timanovskaya says she fled after being warned it was not safe to fly home from the Olympics.

item.title: Lalibela: Ethiopia's Tigray rebels take Unesco world heritage town
item.description: Forces from the Tigray region have taken control of Lalibela, home to famed rock-hewn churches.

item.title: Munchausen by Internet: Are chronic illness influencers really faking it?
item.description: Munchausen by Internet: Are some influencers faking illnesses for fame, money and attention?

item.title: California Gold Rush town 'destroyed' by state's largest wildfire
item.description: The Dixie Fire, the largest burning in California, has razed much of the town of Greenville.

item.title: Andrew Cuomo faces impeachment threat as New York governor
item.description: Fellow Democrats are urging New York’s governor to quit or be forced out after a report into alleged harassment.

item.title: Lionel Messi will not stay at Barcelona
item.description: Barcelona say Lionel Messi will not be staying at the club "because of financial and structural obstacles".

item.title: Russian gay family flees to Spain after threats
item.description: The lesbian family suffered homophobic abuse after appearing in a Russian health food ad.

item.title: Notorious 'Ndrangheta mafia fugitive arrested after two years on the run
item.description: Mobster Domenico Paviglianiti, known as the "boss of the bosses", has been arrested in Madrid.

item.title: Turkish influencer prosecuted 'for photos at Amsterdam sex museum'
item.description: Merve Taskin says she faces obscenity charges in Turkey after posting "joke" photos of sex toys.

item.title: US to allow visitors from Hong Kong to stay for 18 months
item.description: Thousands can stay in US for 18 months because China is eroding territory's freedoms, the US president says.

item.title: TikTok tests Snapchat style vanishing video stories feature
item.description: The news comes as Facebook's WhatsApp starts to roll out a disappearing photos and videos feature.

item.title: How a fake network pushes pro-China propaganda
item.description: The web of 350 fake social media profiles aims to discredit the West, sometimes with garish cartoons.

item.title: Why whales in Alaska have been so happy
item.description: What will happen to Alaska's whales when tourism returns to waters stilled by Covid?

item.title: Mapping the advance of the Taliban in Afghanistan
item.description: Maps of Afghanistan show who controls districts in fighting between the government and Taliban forces.

item.title: COP26: What is the UN climate conference in Glasgow and why is it so important?
item.description: The annual climate change summit is being held in Glasgow - who's going and what's at stake?

item.title: Tucker Carlson: What the Fox News host is doing in Hungary
item.description: The controversial news host is the latest high-profile ally of Hungary's embattled prime minister.

item.title: Simone Biles 'shows how much gymnastics has changed'
item.description: Biles' withdrawal shows how attitudes have changed, says former USA gymnast Dominique Moceanu.

item.title: Article 370: Why more locals in Kashmir are becoming militants
item.description: Two years after India revoked Kashmir's status, more locals are taking up arms in the disputed region.

item.title: Jack Antonoff has redefined pop music. Here's how
item.description: Taylor Swift, Lana Del Rey and Lorde all rely on his advice. Now he's making a statement of his own.

item.title: Athlete Krystina Timanovskaya: 'It's dangerous for me in Belarus'
item.description: Athlete Krystina Timanovskaya tells the BBC that she can't return to her home country over safety fears.

item.title: Four-year-old US piano prodigy flourishing amid pandemic
item.description: Brigitte's parents just wanted to keep her busy. Now, she's been invited to play at Carnegie Hall.

item.title: Greece wildfires force people to flee island by boat
item.description: Scores of people on Evia were forced to evacuate by sea as wildfire spread rapidly, destroying homes.

item.title: Beirut blast: ‘The day our city exploded’
item.description: One year on from the blast that rocked Beirut, no one has yet been made accountable.

item.title: Lebanon blast: ‘Path towards reform irreversible’
item.description: We owe it to our people to tackle issues which led to the blast, the ambassador to the UK says.

item.title: Teenager Quan sets record to win women's diving gold
item.description: Chinese diver Quan Hongchan, 14, sets a new world record to beat 15-year-old Chen Yuxi and win women's diving 10m platform gold.

item.title: Elaine Thompson-Herah: Instagram blocks gold medallist who shared race win
item.description: The Jamaican sprinter was blocked after posting footage of her races on her Instagram account.

item.title: Team USA to face France in basketball final
item.description: Team USA will play France in the final of the men's basketball as they chase their fourth consecutive gold medal.

item.title: Peter Bol: The Sudanese-Australian runner who lifted a nation
item.description: Peter Bol's Olympics has delighted Australians, becoming a "symbol of what we can aspire to be".

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Sky Brown eyes surfing at Paris 2024 after skateboarding bronze
item.description: After making history by becoming Great Britain's youngest ever Olympic medal winner, skateboarder Sky Brown is already plotting her next move.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Sydney McLaughlin smashes record, Kokona Hiraki, 12, wins silver
item.description: Hurdler Sydney McLaughlin smashes her own world record to win 400m hurdles gold on the day 12-year-old Kokona Hiraki becomes the youngest Olympic medallist for 85 years.
